blocks.text: Cairo2 is the base engine used for detection.

orderList.code: sudo apt-get install libcairo2-dev libjpeg-dev libpango1.0-dev libgif-dev build-essential g++
sudo yum install cairo-devel libjpeg-turbo-devel giflib-devel -y

orderList.text: Navigate to your Shinobi directory and install the node.js wrappers needed to run the plugin.
Setup the configuration file for the plugin.
OPTIONAL : Modify the conf.json to match your current listening port. Default is 8080.
Check that your main configuration file, for the main Shinobi app, has a Plugin Key set. If one is not set the plugin will not work. You may review conf.sample.json to see the default setup.
When complete you will see Detector : Motion Connected in your Monitor Settings. Shinobi does not need to be restarted unless you modified the PluginKeys in conf.json

blocks.text: Important information to note are as follows.

list.text: UI Element > Motion Meter : When motion occurs a red bar will appear under your stream to indicate how much motion has happened.
Monitor Settings > Detector > Send Frames : Enabling this will push frames to your detection plugin for analyzation.

Monitor Settings > Detector > Indifference : The opposite of sensitivity. Until what level of confidence should the plugin allow motion until setting off a trigger. This is also the global indifference value.
Monitor Settings > Detector > Region Editor > Indifference : If this value is left blank the global indifference value will be used.
